Nice for me. The best following for black involves c5 or c6, opening the way for the black queen to b6 and attacking b2.

A waste of time. This move would have been ok AFTER I played Nd2, that allows ideas of a sac in c3, that can be dangerous in some circunstances.
g4 is not bad, to prevent definitively the sac in c3. But I made another plan.
g4 is not bad, to prevent definitively the sac in c3. But I made another plan.
I forsaw Nxc6, with a double attack with Qa4. The best answer for black is NxN, followed by c6, B or Qc7, with a good game.
I'll never know if black saw the double attack of Qa4, but he went for it. If I had one more move, g5, now I could have played Qh5+, with a very good attack.
Oh, wonderful... but not. This was the lesson. Look what happens after Qxc6...
